page.title: 05HOUSING IN LAUGHTON
page.content: Some of the houses in our area are very old, in some cases as old as 650 years, whilst others are only a few months or years old. Some of the older houses are Tudor homes with black and white beams, others are mansion houses or houses with grounds of their own, set back in the countryside. A few of the homes were originally two or three houses which have now been converted into large single ones. Some of the houses are built in the Sussex style where the roof, instead of going straight up and down in the usual way, have two triangular pieces of tiling added to the gable ends. These houses are typically 250 years old. A small estate of eight houses is now being built especially for young people. Hopefully new families will ensure a stable future for Laughton.
